cnbc.title: Mortgage rates drop to lowest level in nearly 3 years as Trump orders buying of $200 billion in mortgage bonds
cnbc.summary: President Donald Trump posted on social media Thursday that he is instructing mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to buy $200 billion in mortgage bonds.

cnbc.title: Trump: ‘We are going to do something on Greenland whether they like it or not’
cnbc.summary: Trump said that if the U.S. doesn't take action on Greenland, "Russia or China will take over" the Danish island territory.

cnbc.title: Trump says oil companies will spend $100 billion in Venezuela with U.S. protection
cnbc.summary: The oil industry has been mostly silent on Venezuela as the security situation and stability of the government in Caracas is far from clear.

cnbc.title: OpenAI and SoftBank announce $1 billion investment in SB Energy as part of massive AI buildout
cnbc.summary: OpenAI and SoftBank agreed to invest $1 billion into a SoftBank-backed energy provider as the companies prepare for a massive buildout of AI data centers.

cnbc.title: New cellphone video of Minneapolis ICE shooting incident revealed
cnbc.summary: The Trump administration has accused Renee Nicole Good of engaging in domestic terrorism. Others have said she was the victim in the incident.

cnbc.title: Amazon plans first big-box retail store in Chicago suburb
cnbc.summary: Amazon has submitted plans for a large-format store near Chicago that would be larger than a Walmart Supercenter.

cnbc.title: Grok and X should be suspended from Apple, Google app stores, Democratic senators say
cnbc.summary: Senators from Oregon, Massachusetts and New Mexico urged Apple and Google to suspend X and Grok until Elon Musk curbs AI-generated sexualized images of kids.

cnbc.title: Supreme Court holds off on Trump tariff ruling for now — what's at stake for economy
cnbc.summary: The decision is poised to have far-reaching impacts on not only trade policy but also the U.S. fiscal situation.

cnbc.title: Oracle announces departure of two oldest directors, narrowing board to 12
cnbc.summary: George Conrades and Naomi Seligman, who are both in their 80s, have been on Oracle's board for over 15 years.

cnbc.title: U.S. payrolls rose 50,000 in December, less than expected; unemployment rate falls to 4.4%
cnbc.summary: The report presented a muddy view of the labor market, with companies reporting a low level of hiring but households showing employment gains.
